Core.desc: The core of MooTools, contains all the base functions and the Native and Hash implementations. Required by all the other scripts.

Browser.desc: The Browser Core. Contains Browser initialization, Window and Document, and the Browser Hash.

Array.desc: Contains Array Prototypes like each, contains, and erase.

Function.desc: Contains Function Prototypes like create, bind, pass, and delay.

Number.desc: Contains Number Prototypes like limit, round, times, and ceil.

String.desc: Contains String Prototypes like camelCase, capitalize, test, and toInt.

Hash.desc: Contains Hash Prototypes. Provides a means for overcoming the JavaScript practical impossibility of extending native Objects.

Event.desc: Contains the Event Class, to make the event object cross-browser.

Class.desc: Contains the Class Function for easily creating, extending, and implementing reusable Classes.

Class.Extras.desc: Contains Utility Classes that can be implemented into your own Classes to ease the execution of many common tasks.

Element.desc: One of the most important items in MooTools. Contains the dollar function, the dollars function, and an handful of cross-browser, time-saver methods to let you easily work with HTML Elements.

Element.Event.desc: Contains Element methods for dealing with events. This file also includes mouseenter and mouseleave custom Element Events.

Element.Style.desc: Contains methods for interacting with the styles of Elements in a fashionable way.

Element.Dimensions.desc: Contains methods to work with size, scroll, or positioning of Elements and the window object.

Selectors.desc: Adds advanced CSS-style querying capabilities for targeting HTML Elements. Includes pseudo selectors.

Cookie.desc: Class for creating, reading, and deleting browser Cookies.

Swiff.desc: Wrapper for embedding SWF movies. Supports External Interface Communication.

Fx.desc: Contains the basic animation logic to be extended by all other Fx Classes.

Fx.CSS.desc: Contains the CSS animation logic. Used by Fx.Tween, Fx.Morph, Fx.Elements.

Fx.Tween.desc: Formerly Fx.Style, effect to transition any CSS property for an element.

Fx.Morph.desc: Formerly Fx.Styles, effect to transition any number of CSS properties for an element using an object of rules, or CSS based selector rules.

Fx.Transitions.desc: Contains a set of advanced transitions to be used with any of the Fx Classes.

Request.desc: Powerful all purpose Request Class. Uses XMLHTTPRequest.

Request.HTML.desc: Extends the basic Request Class with additional methods for interacting with HTML responses.

Request.JSON.desc: Extends the basic Request Class with additional methods for sending and receiving JSON data.

Lang.desc: Enables classes to contain text that can be localized to specific languages.

Log.desc: A default logger for MooTools. Logs to Firebug or a similar console unless it is not present.

Depender.desc: A stand alone dependency loader for the MooTools library.

Class.Refactor.desc: Allows for a class to extend itself without damaging it's namespace.

Class.Binds.desc: Adds the Binds Mutator to all classes.

Class.Occlude.desc: Mixin class for preventing a class from applying itself to the same element twice.

Chain.Wait.desc: Adds a delay method for chaining that allows you to easily introduce pauses.

Array.Extras.desc: Extends the Array native object to include useful methods to work with arrays.

Date.English.US.desc: Date messages in English (with conventions for the US).

Date.desc: Extends the Date native object to include methods useful in managing dates.

Date.Extras.desc: Extends the Date native object to include extra methods (on top of those in Date.js).

Hash.Extras.desc: Extends the Hash native object to include getFromPath which allows a path notation to child elements.

String.Extras.desc: Extends the String native object to include methods useful in managing strings (query strings, urls, etc).

String.QueryString.desc: String shortcuts for working with query strings.

URI.desc: Provides methods useful in managing the window location and uris.

URI.Relative.desc: Extends the URI class to add methods for computing relative and absolute urls.

Element.Forms.desc: Extends the Element native object to include methods useful in managing inputs.

Elements.From.desc: Adds a static method to Element to parse html.

Element.Delegation.desc: Delegates events for child elements to their parents for greater efficiency.

Element.Measure.desc: Extends the Element native object to include methods useful in measuring dimensions.

Element.Pin.desc: Extends the Element native object to include the pin method useful for fixed positioning for elements.

Element.Position.desc: Extends the Element native object to include methods useful positioning elements relative to others.

Element.Shortcuts.desc: Extends the Element native object to include some shortcut methods.

IframeShim.desc: Creates a transparent iframe to mask out items not drawn by the browser (flash, select lists, etc) for IE6.

Mask.desc: Creates a mask over a specified element.

Spinner.desc: Adds a semi-transparent overlay over a dom element with a spinnin ajax icon.

Form.Request.desc: Handles the basic functionality of submitting a form via ajax and updating a DOM element with the result.

Fx.Reveal.desc: Executes a transition from display:block to display:none and vice versa.

Form.Request.Append.desc: Uses Form.Request to fetch and update a DOM element, but appends the result into the target instead of overwriting its contents.

Form.Validator.desc: A css-class based form validation system.

Form.Validator.Inline.desc: A css-class based form validation system.

OverText.desc: Displays text over empty inputs until the user focuses the input or adds information.

Fx.Elements.desc: Effect to change any number of CSS properties of any number of Elements.

Fx.Accordion.desc: An Fx.Elements extension which allows you to easily create accordion type controls.

Fx.Move.desc: Moves an element to another location (relative to another element) with a transition.

Fx.Scroll.desc: Effect to smoothly scroll any element, including the window.

Fx.Slide.desc: Effect to slide an element in and out of view.

Fx.SmoothScroll.desc: Class for creating a smooth scrolling effect to all internal links on the page.

Fx.Sort.desc: Reorders a group of items with a transition.

Drag.desc: The base Drag Class. Can be used to drag and resize Elements using mouse events.

Drag.Move.desc: A Drag extension that provides support for the constraining of draggables to containers and droppables.

Slider.desc: Class for creating horizontal and vertical slider controls.

Sortables.desc: Class for creating a drag and drop sorting interface for lists of items.

Request.JSONP.desc: Creates a Json request using a script tag include and handles the callbacks for you.

Request.Queue.desc: Manages a group of Request instances so that connections are queued.

Request.Periodical.desc: Requests the same url at a time interval that increases when no data is returned from the requested server.

Assets.desc: Provides methods to dynamically load JavaScript, CSS, and Image files into the document.

Color.desc: Class for creating and manipulating colors in JavaScript. Supports HSB -> RGB Conversions and vice versa.

Group.desc: Class for monitoring collections of events.

Hash.Cookie.desc: Class for creating, reading, and deleting browser Cookies in JSON format.

HtmlTable.desc: Builds table elements with methods to add rows quickly.

HtmlTable.Zebra.desc: Adds stripes to an HTML table's rows.

HtmlTable.Sort.desc: Adds the ability to sort the columns of a HtmlTable.Zebra instance.

Keyboard.desc: Provides enhanced group key event management.

HtmlTable.Select.desc: Adds the ability to highlight and select rows on a HtmlTable.Sort instance.

Keyboard.Extras.desc: Adds description functionality to the Keyboard

Scroller.desc: Class which scrolls the contents of any Element (including the window) when the mouse reaches the Element's boundaries.

Tips.desc: Class for creating nice tooltips that follow the mouse cursor when hovering over an element.

Date.English.GB.desc: Date messages in English (with conventions for Great Britain).

Date.Portuguese.BR.desc: Date messages in Portuguese for Brazil.

Form.Validator.Portuguese.BR.desc: Form.Validator messages in Portuguese localized for Brazil.

common.desc: Jx namespace with methods and classes common to most Jx widgets

styles.desc: A singleton object useful for dynamically creating and manipulating CSS styles

object.desc: Base class for all other object in the JxLib framework.

locale.english.desc: Default translations of text strings used in JX for US english (en-US)

widget.desc: Base class for all widgets (visual classes) in the JxLib Framework.

selection.desc: A class to manage selection across multiple list objects

list.desc: A class that is used to manage lists of DOM elements

stack.desc: A singleton object for managing a global z-index stack for widgets that need to order themselves in the z-index of the page relative to other such widgets.

locale.german.desc: Default translations of text strings used in JX for German (Germany) (de-DE)

locale.russian.desc: Default translations of text strings used in JX for Russia (Russia) (ru-RU)

record.desc: The basic record implementation. A store uses records to handle and manipulate data.

store.desc: An implementation of a basic data store.

compare.desc: Class that provides functions for comparing various data types. Used by the Jx.Sort class and it's descendants

sort.desc: Base class for the sort algorithm implementations

mergesort.desc: An implementation of the merge sort algorithm

heapsort.desc: An implementation of the heap sort algorithm

quicksort.desc: An implementation of the quick sort algorithm

nativesort.desc: An implementation of the Javascript native sorting with the Jx.Sort interface

response.desc: The object used to return response information to strategies.

protocol.desc: Base class for all store protocols.

protocol.local.desc: Store protocol used to load data that is already present in a page as an object.

protocol.ajax.desc: Store protocol used to load data from a remote data source via Ajax.

strategy.desc: Base class for all store strategies.

strategy.full.desc: Strategy for loading the full data set from a source.

strategy.paginate.desc: Strategy for loading data in pages and moving between them. This strategy makes sure the store only contains the current page's data.

strategy.progressive.desc: Strategy based on Strategy.Paginate but loads data progressively without removing old or curent data from the store.

strategy.save.desc: Strategy used for saving data back to a source. Can be called manually or setup to automatically save on every change.

strategy.sort.desc: Strategy used for sorting results in a store after they are loaded.

parser.desc: Base class for all data parsers. Parsers are used by protocols to get data received or sent in the proper formats.

parser.json.desc: Parser for reading and writting JSON formatted data.

button.desc: Jx.Button creates a clickable element that can be added to a web page.

flyout.desc: Flyout buttons expose a panel when the user clicks the button.

colorpalette.desc: A Jx.ColorPalette presents a user interface for selecting colors.  This is typically combined with a Jx.Button.Color which embeds the color palette in a flyout.

color.desc: A Jx.ColorPalette wrapped up in a Jx.Button.

menu.desc: A main menu as opposed to a sub menu that lives inside the menu.

menu.item.desc: A menu item is a single entry in a menu.

set.desc: A ButtonSet manages a set of Jx.Button instances by ensuring that only one of the buttons is active.

multi.desc: Multi buttons are used to contain multiple buttons in a drop down list where only one button is actually visible and clickable in the interface.

layout.desc: Jx.Layout is used to provide more flexible layout options for applications

toolbar.desc: A toolbar is a container object that contains other objects such as buttons.

container.desc: A toolbar container contains toolbars.  This has an optional dependency on Fx.Tween that, if included, will allow toolbars that contain more elements than can be displayed to be smoothly scrolled left and right.  Without this optional dependency, the toolbar will jump in fixed increments rather than smoothly scrolling.

toolbar.item.desc: A helper class to provide a container for something to go into a Jx.Toolbar.

panel.desc: A panel is a fundamental container object that has a content area and optional toolbars around the content area.

dialog.desc: A Jx.Dialog that implements a floating dialog.

splitter.desc: A Jx.Splitter creates two or more containers within a parent container and provides user control over the size of the containers.

panelset.desc: A panel set manages a set of panels within a DOM element.

message.desc: A subclass of jx.Dialog for displaying messages w/a single OK button.

confirm.desc: A subclass of Jx.dialog for asking a yes/no type question of the user.

tooltip.desc: These are very simple tooltips that are designed to be instantiated in javascript and directly attached to the object that they are the tip for.

fieldset.desc: Used to create fieldsets in Forms

prompt.desc: A subclass of Jx.dialog for prompting the user for text input.

dataview.desc: A panel used for displaying records from a store in a list-style interface rather than a grid.

group.desc: A subclass of Dataview that can display records in groups.

listitem.desc: Reresents a single item in a listview.

listview.desc: A widget that displays items in a list format.

file.desc: Represents a file input w/upload and progress tracking capabilities (requires APC for progress)

upload.desc: A panel subclass that is designed to be a multiple file upload panel with a queue listing.

column.desc: A representation of a single grid column

columns.desc: A container for defining and holding individual columns

row.desc: Holds information related to display of rows in the grid.

grid.desc: A tabular control that has fixed scrolling headers on the rows and columns like a spreadsheet.

renderer.desc: Base class for all renderers. Used to create the contents of column.

renderer.checkbox.desc: Renders a checkbox in a column. Can be connected to a store column or as a standalone check column.

renderer.button.desc: Renders one or more buttons in a single column.

grid.selector.desc: Allows selecting rows, columns, and cells in grids

grid.prelighter.desc: Highlights rows, columns, cells, and headers in grids

slide.desc: A class that shows and hides elements using a slide effect. Does not use a wrapper element or require a fixed width or height.

dataview.groupfolder.desc: Enables closing and opening groups in a group dataview

field.validator.desc: Provides validation services for Jx.Field subclasses

toolbarContainer.tabMenu.desc: Adds a menu of tabs to the toolbar container for easy access to all tabs.

adaptor.tree.desc: Base class for all adaptors that fill Jx.Tree widgets. Also acts as the namespace for other Jx.Tree adaptors.

tree.mptt.desc: Fills a Jx.Tree instance from a remote table that represents an MPTT (Modified Preorder Table Traversal) data source.

tree.parent.desc: Fills a Jx.Tree instance from a standard parent/child/folder style data table.

combo.fill.desc: Loads data into a Jx.Combo instance from designated column(s) of a data source.

context.desc: A Jx.Menu that has no button but can be opened at a specific browser location to implement context menus (for instance).

menu.separator.desc: Convenience class to create a visual separator in a menu.

submenu.desc: A sub menu contains menu items within a main menu or another sub menu.

snap.desc: A helper class to create an element that can snap a split panel open or closed.

tab.desc: A single tab in a tab set.

tabset.desc: A TabSet manages a set of Jx.Tab content areas by ensuring that only one of the content areas is visible (i.e. the active tab).

tabbox.desc: A convenience class to handle the common case of a single toolbar directly attached to the content area of the tabs.

toolbar.separator.desc: A helper class that represents a visual separator in a Jx.Toolbar.

tree.desc: Jx.Tree displays hierarchical data in a tree structure of folders and nodes.

treefolder.desc: A Jx.TreeFolder is an item in a tree that can contain other items. It is expandable and collapsible.

slider.desc: A wrapper for mootools' slider class to make it more Jx Friendly.

notice.desc: Represents a single item used in a notifier.

notifier.desc: Base class for notification areas that can hold temporary notices.

notifier.float.desc: A notification area that floats in a container above other content.

scrollbar.desc: An implementation of a custom CSS-styled scrollbar.

number.desc: Formats numbers including negative and floats

currency.desc: Formats input as currency. Currently only US currency is supported

date.desc: Formats dates using the mootools-more Date extensions

uri.desc: Formats uris using the mootools-more URI extensions

phone.desc: Formats phone numbers in US format including area code

formatter.text.desc: Formats strings to an optional maximum length

select.desc: Represents a select, or drop down, input

jxcolor.desc: Represents an input field with a jx.button.color
